cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles SW of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across Hispaniola and Cuba, then into the Gulf of Mexico toward the north-western Gulf Coast (LA/TX)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast near/just east of Lake Charles

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas; Cuban provinces of Las Tunas, Holguin, Guantanamo, Santiago de Cuba, and Granma
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Dominican Republic north & south coasts, northern Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks and Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, Cuba, Bahamas, Florida Keys, and the north-western Gulf Coast from Texas through Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Potential for sustained 40–60 mph winds with higher gusts if the core tracks near the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft surge possible in Sabine-Neches estuary and adjacent coastline if the center comes ashore east of Beaumont.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood risk and river rises around Beaumont.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and dangerous surf that could halt vessel movements, possible coastal flooding of low-lying port facilities, and brief tornado risk in outer rainbands.
